tit.cmt: 奈良鉄道→Nara Railway としました。

sen.j: 奈良鉄道（ならてつどう）は現在の奈良線全線、桜井線の過半などを建設、運営していた日本の私鉄であった。
sen.e: Nara Tetsudo was a Japanese private railway company that had constructed and managed a whole part of the current Nara Line and a major part of the current Sakurai Line.
Nara Tetsudo was a Japanese private railway company that constructed and managed the entire current Nara Line and over half of the current Sakurai Line.
sen.cmt: Removed "had", changed "a whole part of" to "the entire", changed "a major part" to "over half".
sen.e: Nara Railway was a Japanese private railway company that constructed and managed the entire current Nara Line and over half of the current Sakurai Line.
sen.cmt: 奈良鉄道→Nara Railway としました。

sen.j: 全路線は1905年に関西鉄道に譲渡され、さらに1907年に国有化された。
sen.e: In 1905, their all lines were assigned to Kansai Tetsudo (Kansai Railway Company), which was later nationalized in 1907.
In 1905, all their lines were assigned to Kansai Tetsudo (Kansai Railway Company), which was nationalized in 1907.
sen.cmt: Changed "their all" to "all their", removed "later".
sen.e: In 1905, all their lines were assigned to Kansei Railway Company, which was nationalized in 1907.
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: 京都と奈良を結ぶ鉄道として計画された。
sen.e: A plan was made to construct a railway connecting Kyoto and Nara.
The railway was planned to connect Kyoto and Nara.
sen.cmt: Changed "A plan was made to construct a railway connecting" to "The railway was planned to connect".
sen.e: The railway was planned to connect Kyoto and Nara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 建設は京都から進められ、1895年（明治29年）に京都 - 奈良間が全通した。
sen.e: Construction began from Kyoto side, and the whole line between Kyoto and Nara was completed in 1895.
Construction began from the Kyoto side, and the whole line between Kyoto and Nara was completed in 1895.
sen.cmt: Inserted "the".
sen.e: Construction began from the Kyoto side, and the whole line between Kyoto and Nara was completed in 1895.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、奈良 - 桜井間はこの区間を建設していた初瀬鉄道を（明治30年）に合併し、1898年（明治32年）に全通した。
sen.e: Another railway section between Nara and Sakurai was completed in 1898, after Nara Tetsudo had merged Hatsuse Tetsudo (Hatsuse Railway Company) in 1896, which was then constructing the relevant section.

Another railway section between Nara and Sakurai was completed in 1898, after the 1896 merger of Nara Tetsudo with Hatsuse Tetsudo (Hatsuse Railway Company), which was constructing the relevant section at the time.
sen.cmt: Changed "after Nara Tetsudo had merged Hatsuse Tetsudo (Hatsuse Railway Company) in 1896" to "after the 1896 merger of Nara Tetsudo with Hatsuse Tetsudo (Hatsuse Railway Company)", removed "then", inserted "at the time".
sen.e: Another railway section between Nara and Sakurai was completed in 1898, after the 1896 merger of Nara Railway with Hatsuse Railway, which was constructing the relevant section at the time.
sen.cmt: 初瀬鉄道→Hatsuse Railway としました。

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）に近畿鉄道合同の交渉が持たれ、南和鉄道とともに関西鉄道に合流を決めた。
sen.e: In 1904, when consolidation of railway companies in Kinki region was negotiated, Nara Tetsudo together with Nanwa Tetsudo (Nanwa Railway Company) decided to merge with Kansai Tetsudo.
In 1904, a consolidation of Kinki region railway companies was negotiated, and both Nara Tetsudo and Nanwa Tetsudo (Nanwa Railway Company) decided to merge with Kansai Tetsudo.
sen.cmt: Changed "when consolidation of railway companies in Kinki region" to "a consolidation of Kinki region railway companies", changed "Nara Tetsudo together with Nanwa Tetsudo" to "and both Nara Tetsudo and Nanwa Tetsudo".
sen.e: In 1904, a consolidation of Kinki region railway companies was negotiated, and both Nara Railway and Nanwa Railway decided to merge with Kansei Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 南和鉄道→Nanwa Railway としました。

sen.j: 翌1905年（明治38年）に鉄道一切が引き継がれた。
sen.e: In the following year, 1905, the whole railway assets of Nara Tetsudo were taken over by Kansai Tetsudo.
In the following year, 1905, all of Nara Tetsudo's railway assets were taken over by Kansai Tetsudo.
sen.cmt: Changed "the whole railway assets of Nara Tetsudo" to "all of Nara Tetsudo's railway assets".
sen.e: In the following year, 1905, all of Nara Railway's railway assets were taken over by Kansei Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。奈良鉄道→Nara Railway としました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）9月5日 京都駅 - 伏見駅 (京都府)間3マイル23チェーン (単位)開業
sen.e: In September 5, 1895, a line of three miles and twenty-three chains (about 5.5 kilometer) began its operation between Kyoto Station and Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
On September 5, 1895, a line three miles and twenty-three chains long (about 5.5 kilometers) began operations between Kyoto Station and Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "kilometer" from singular to plural, changed "its operation" to "operations".
sen.e: September 5, 1895: A line 3 miles and 23 chains (unit) long began operations between Kyoto Station and Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）11月3日 伏見 - 桃山駅間1M9C開業
sen.e: In November 3, 1895, a line of one mile and nine chains (about 1.8 kilometer) began its operation between Fushimi and Momoyama Stations.
On November 3, 1895, a line one mile and nine chains long (about 1.8 kilometers) began operations between Fushimi and Momoyama stations.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "kilometer" from singular to plural, changed "its operation" to "operations", removed capital from "stations".
sen.e: November 3, 1895: A line 1 mile and 9 chains long began operations between Fushimi Station and Momoyama Station.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 桃山 - 玉水駅間12M46C開業
sen.e: In January 25, 1896, a line of twelve miles and forty-six chains (about 20 kilometers) began its operation between Momoyama Station and Tamamizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
On January 25, 1896, a line twelve miles and forty-six chains long (about 20 kilometers) began operations between Momoyama and Tamamizu stations (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "its operation" to "operations", removed one "station", removed capital from "stations".
sen.e: January 25, 1896: A line 12 miles and 46 chains long began operations between Momoyama Station and Tamamizu Station.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）3月13日 玉水 - 木津駅 (京都府)間4M50C開業
sen.e: In March 13, 1896, a line of four miles and fifty chains (about 7 kilometer) began its operation between Tamamizu Station and Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
On March 13, 1896, a line four miles and fifty chains long (about 7 kilometers) began operations between Tamamizu and Kizu stations (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "kilometer" from singular to plural, changed "its operation" to "operations", removed one "station", removed capital from "stations".
sen.e: March 13, 1896: A line 4 miles and 50 chains long began operations between Tamamizu Station and Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）4月18日 木津 - 奈良駅間4M32C開業
sen.e: In April 18, 1896, a line of four miles and thirty-two chains began its operation between Kizu and Nara Stations.
On April 18, 1896, a line four miles and thirty-two chains long began operations between Kizu and Nara stations.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "its operation" to "operations", removed capital from "stations".
sen.e: April 18, 1896: A line 4 miles and 32 chains long began operations between Kizu Station and Nara Station.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）5月11日 桜井駅 (奈良県) - 京終駅間11M10C開業
sen.e: In May 11, 1898, a line of eleven miles and ten chains began its operation between Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture) and Kyobate Station.
On May 11, 1898, a line eleven miles and ten chains long began operations between Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture) and Kyobate Station.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "its operation" to "operations".
sen.e: May 11, 1898: A line 11 miles and 10 chains long began operations between Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture) and Kyobate Station.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）2月11日 京終 - 奈良間仮連絡線により貨物営業開始
sen.e: In February 11, 1899, a tentative link line between Kyobate and Nara began its cargo transport business.
On February 11, 1899, cargo transport began along a tentative link line between Kyobate and Nara.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", inserted "cargo transport began along", removed "began its cargo transport business".
sen.e: February 11, 1899: Freight transport began along a tentative link line between Kyobate and Nara.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）10月14日 奈良 - 京終間1M5C開業
sen.e: In October 14, 1899, a line of one mile and five chains (about 1.7 kilometer) began its operation between Kyobate and Nara.
On October 14, 1899, a line one mile and five chains long (about 1.7 kilometers) began operations between Kyobate and Nara.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", removed "of", inserted "long", changed "kilometers" from singular to plural, changed "its operation" to "operations".
sen.e: October 14, 1899: A line 1 mile and 5 chains long began operations between Kyobate and Nara.
sen.cmt: 日付＋コロン の表現にしました。

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月8日 関西鉄道に譲渡
sen.e: In February 8, 1905, the whole lines were transferred to Kansai Tetsudo.
On February 8, 1905, all lines were transferred to Kansai Tetsudo.
sen.cmt: Changed "In" to "On", changed "the whole" to "all".
sen.e: February 8, 1905: All lines were transferred to Kansei Railway Company.
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: 関西鉄道に譲渡当時の路線は38マイル15チェーン (単位)であった。
sen.e: Length of the lines transferred to Kansai Tetsudo amounted to thirty-eight miles and fifteen chains (about 61.3 kilometers).
At the time of the transfer to Kansai Tetsudo, the total length of the lines was thirty-eight miles and fifteen chains (about 61.3 kilometers).
sen.cmt: Changed "Length of the lines transferred to Kansai Tetsudo amounted to" to "At the time of the transfer to Kansai Tetsudo, the total length of the lines was".
sen.e: At the time of the transfer to Kansei Railway Company, the total length of the lines was 38 miles and 15 chains (unit).
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。

sen.j: 京都駅 - 奈良駅
sen.e: From Kyoto Staion to Nara Station:
From Kyoto Station to Nara Station:
sen.cmt: Inserted second "t" in "Kyoto Station".
sen.e: From Kyoto Station to Nara Station
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: 七条 - 桃山駅間は現在のJR奈良線のルートとは異なり、近鉄京都線の原型となる伏見駅 (京都府)を経由するルートをとっていた。
sen.e: The section between Shichijo and Momoyama Stations was different from the current route of JR Nara Line but took the route via Fushimi station (Kyoto Prefecture), origin of current Kintetsu Kyoto Line.

The section between Shichijo and Momoyama stations was different from the JR Nara Line's current route in that the route passed through Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture), the origin of the current Kintetsu Kyoto Line.
sen.cmt: Changed "the current route of JR Nara Line" to "the JR Nara Line's current route", changed "but took the route via" to "in that the route passed through", capitalized "Station", inserted "the".
sen.e: The section between Shichijo and Momoyama stations was different from the JR Nara Line's current route in that the route passed through Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture), the origin of the current Kintetsu Kyoto Line.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 奈良 - 桜井駅 (奈良県)
sen.e: From Nara to Sakurai (Nara Prefecture):
From Nara to Sakurai (Nara Prefecture):
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From Nara Station to Sakurai Station (Nara Prefecture)
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: 関西鉄道に引継ぎの車両数は機関車12両、客車91両、貨車106両であった。
sen.e: Kansai Tetsudo took over twelve locomotives, ninety-one passenger coaches and one hundred and six freight wagons.
Kansai Tetsudo took over twelve locomotives, ninety-one passenger coaches and one hundred and six freight wagons.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company took over 12 locomotives, 91 passenger coaches and 106 freight wagons.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に変更しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.e: From 1 to 5:
From 1 to 5:
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From 1 to 5
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国 ボールドウィン・ロコモティブ・ワークス社製2-6-2 (1C1) 形タンク機
sen.e: Tank Locomotives, Type 2-6-2 (1C1) of Baldwin Locomotive Works, U.S,A
Tank Locomotives, Type 2-6-2 (1C1) from Baldwin Locomotive Works, U.S.A.
sen.cmt: Changed "of" to "from", changed "U.S,A" to "U.S.A.".
sen.e: Tank Locomotives, Type 2-6-2 (1C1) from Baldwin Locomotive Works, U.S.A.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 関西鉄道：形式93、春日（かすが）、番号93 - 97
sen.e: Kansai Tetsudo: Type 93, Kasuga, Nos.93 - 997
Kansai Tetsudo: Type 93, Kasuga, Nos. 93 - 997
sen.cmt: Inserted space after "Nos."
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company: Type 93, Kasuga, Nos. 93 - 97
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。

sen.j: 鉄道院：国鉄3030形蒸気機関車
sen.e: Tetsudo-in: Steam Locomotive, Type Kokutetsu (JNR) 3030
Tetsudo-in: Steam Locomotive, Type Kokutetsu (JNR) 3030
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Tetsudo-in (Railway Bureau): Steam Locomotive, Type Kokutetsu (JNR) 3030

sen.e: From 6 to 12:
From 6 to 12:

sen.j: スイス スイス・ロコモティブ・アンド・マシン・ワークス製2-6-0 (1C) 形タンク機
sen.e: Tank Locomotives, Type 2-6-0 (1C) of Swiss Locomotive and Machine Works
Tank Locomotives, Type 2-6-0 (1C) from Swiss Locomotive and Machine Works

sen.j: 関西鉄道：形式98、三笠（みかさ）、98 - 104
sen.e: Kansai Tetsudo: Type 98, Mikasa, Nos.93 - 104
Kansai Tetsudo: Type 98, Mikasa, Nos. 93 - 104
sen.cmt: Inserted space after "Nos."
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company: Type 98, Mikasa, Nos. 93 - 104
sen.cmt: 関西鉄道→Kansei Railway Company としました。

sen.e: Tetsudo-in: Steam Locomotive, Type Kokutetsu (JNR) 2800
